conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graph to determine acceleration from 1 to 3 seconds.
The graph shows velocity as a function of time; it is a straight line with a positive slope.
At t = 1s, velocity is 2 m/s; at t = 2s, velocity is 0 m/s; at t = 3s, velocity is -2 m/s.
Acceleration is the change in velocity divided by the change in time.
Acceleration is given by the derivative of velocity with respect to time.
For positive direction movement, acceleration is positive; for negative direction, acceleration is negative.
Acceleration at t = 1s is calculated as -2 m/s^2.
Acceleration at t = 2s is calculated as 0 m/s^2.
Acceleration at t = 3s is calculated as 0 m/s^2.
The acceleration of the particle during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds is 0 m/s^2.
